For this project, I will be using some vintage teacups, candle wicks,...
...and to not waste any candles, I will be reusing some wax remnants...
First step is to heat and melt the wax.
Next, with a hot glue gun, glue the base of your wick to the bottom of your cup.
To hold the wick up straight, I recommend for you to use a ruler or a stick...
...to hold your wick up straight while pouring in the hot wax.
If you will be pouring on more than one layer of wax,...
...then I recommend for you to let your wax set for 30 minutes or so...
...before pouring on the next layer of wax to give yourself more variety in scent.
A short, simple, and sweet DIY.
